Walls Windows The dwelling’s exterior walls are made of natural The dwelling’s windows are simple slits cut into the 2 stone. Their eroded surfaces appear to offer plenty of cliff wall to admit light. Each measures about 1 foot wide, 6 feet high, and 5 feet deep and is fitted with 2. The floor in this area is recessed about 6 inches, and the Rifinti have filled this space with loose sand taken Light from the lakeshore to assure soft landings for fliers. RAISING THE ALARM The Rifinti have strung perches about 10 feet above Though not particularly warlike, the Rifinti have the floor of this chamber to aid in defense. name: Tactics

description: These arrows have wooden tips spe- cially crafted to deal subdual damage instead of nor- mal damage.
name: Arrow, Blunt

description: This arrow is specially designed to emulate a birdÆs call when fired. Elven fletchers craft the arrows to make calls that will be recognized as signals by the elves of the community. For example, a hawkÆs cry might signal an attack, and an owlÆs screech might signal a stealthy advance. A successful Wilderness Lore check (DC 20) determines whether the sound comes from a bird or another source. The intricate carving on the arrow shafts makes them clumsy in flight, imposing a û2 circumstance penalty on attack rolls.
name: Arrow, Signal

description: The chakram is a throwing disk or quoit about 1 foot in diameter, with a sharpened outer rim.
name: Chakram

description: You can use a khopesh to make trip attacks with its hooklike blade. If you are tripped during your own trip attempt, you can drop the khopesh to avoid being tripped.
name: Khopesh

description: A manti is a shortspear with four addi- tional spear heads that project vertically from the shaft, creating a star pattern of five blade heads instead of just a single forward-pointing blade. The advantage of the unusual blade arrangement is that you can make one additional attack of opportunity during the round.
name: Manti

description: The maul is simply a two-handed war- hammer of enormous size. Dwarves favor it.
name: Maul

description: A stump knife is akin to a punching dagger, except that it can be securely attached to the stump of a missing forelimb. For someone proficient in its use, the stump knife becomes an extension of his body. Against foes to whom you have dealt dam- age during a continuous melee, the stump knifeÆs threat range is doubled (17û20).
name: Stump Knife

description: A zen warrior using a tonfa can strike with her unarmed base attack bonus, including her more favorable number of attacks per round, along with other applicable modifiers.
name: Tonfa

description: Bondleaf wraps are each crafted from a single enormous leaf found on magi- cal trees. A bondleaf wrap is inactive until worn for 24 hours. During this time, it grows into the skin, drawing water and nutri- ents from its host. Afterward, as a standard action, you can com- mand it to wrap around your body.
name: Bondleaf Wrap

description: CR 1/2; Tiny vermin; HD 1d8; hp 4; Init +6; Spd 10 ft., fly 40 ft. (good); AC 24 (touch 18, flat-footed 18); Atk û3 melee (1d3û5, bite); Face/ Reach 2 1/2 ft. by 2 1/2 ft./0 ft.; SQ Deflect arrows, vermin traits; AL N; SV Fort +2, Ref +6, Will +0; Str 1, Dex 23, Con 10, Int ù, Wis 10, Cha 2.
name: Beetle Buckler

description: Immune to all mind-influencing effects; darkvision 60 ft.
name: Vermin Traits

description: The ivy exudes a poisonous resin. Once per day, if you succeed on a grapple check, your foe must make a Fortitude save (DC 14). If the defender fails, he takes initial and secondary damage of 1d3 points of temporary Constitution. This poison never affects the wearer.
name: Poison Ivy

description: The ivy is laced with noxious, explosive spores. Each day, the ivy grows 1d3 spore pods, to a maximum of ten pods. Whenever you are struck in combat with a bludgeoning attack, one of the spores explodes into the space from which the attack came. Anyone in that 5-foot square must suc- ceed on a Fortitude save (DC 14) or be nauseated for 1d6 rounds. Once all of a dayÆs spores are exhausted, the effect is inert until the next day. This nausea never affects the wearer.
name: Explosive Spores

description: Combat Refl exes lets you break the “you can make WHAT GIVES BIRTH only one attack of opportunity per round” rule. Spring Attack TO RULES TODAY? provides an exception to a more fundamental rule, letting Essentially, my job is to sit at this desk and crank out new you interrupt your own move action to make an attack, then rules for you. So where do I come up with new rules? resume the move.

name: Ability Damaged

description: See page 76. holding, can’t take actions, takes a –2 penalty to AC, and is
name: Invisible

description: You can move half your speed, bringing all others ATTACKING GRAPPLERS engaged in the grapple with you, by winning an opposed grapple check. Doing this requires a standard action, and Those not engaged in a grapple can attack those engaged you must beat all the other grapplers’ individual grapple in a grapple. Grapplers take the aforementioned penalties check results to move the grapple. You get a +4 bonus on to AC. If you make a ranged attack against a grappler while your grapple check to move a pinned opponent, but only if not engaged in the grapple, you roll randomly to see which no one else is involved in the grapple. grappler your attack strikes.
name: Move

description: The opponent takes a –2 penalty on its initia- false information. tive check and a –1 penalty on attack rolls against you for You can check against each use of the Bluff skill to com- 1 round. municate a secret message.
name: Submit

description: The opponent ignores you, but if you succeed on a DC 15 Intimidate check, you receive a +1 morale bonus on Hunch attack rolls against that opponent for 1 round. With a successful DC 20 Sense Motive check and 1 minute,
name: Ignore

description: A light source can be spotted at a distance equal to 20 times its radius of illumination.
name: Observer in Complete Darkness

description: A light source can be spotted at a distance equal to 10 times its radius of illumination.
name: Observer in Dim Light

description: Armbands, bracelets, bracers.
name: Arms

description: Goggles, lenses, masks, spectacles, third eyes. As long as you’re the same size category and the same general
name: Face

description: Gauntlets, gloves. normally for you. However, inappropriately sized or shaped
name: Hands

description: You can use the Hide skill to blend and up into a crowd, but doing so conceals you only from someone scanning the area to fi nd you. You remain visible to everyone
name: Blend into a Crowd

description: The ability to stay in one place while airborne. as normal.
name: Hover

description: The ability to move backward without Sneak up from Hiding: You can sneak up on someone turning around. after emerging from a hiding place. For every 5 feet of open
name: Move Backward

description: A long jump is a horizontal jump, made across a gap like a chasm or stream. At the midpoint of the jump, you attain a vertical height equal to one-quarter of the horizontal distance. The DC for the jump is equal to the distance jumped (in feet). If your check succeeds, you land at the far end. If you fail the check by less than 5, you don’t clear the distance, but you grab the far edge of the gap if you succeed on a DC 15 Refl ex save. You end your movement grasping the far edge if the save succeeds. If that leaves you dangling over a chasm or gap, clambering up requires a move action and a DC 15 Climb check.
name: Long Jump

description: A high jump is a vertical leap made to reach something overhead. The DC is equal to four times the distance to be cleared. Vertical reach (see below) can help you reach your intended height. If you jumped up to grab something, a successful check indicates that you reached the desired height. If you want to pull yourself up, you can do so with a move action and a DC 15 Climb check. If you fail the Jump check, you don’t reach the height, and you land in the space you jumped from.
name: High Jump

description: You can jump up onto an object as tall as your waist with a DC 10 Jump check. Doing so counts as 10 feet of movement. You don’t need to get a running start to hop up, so the DC isn’t doubled if you don’t get a running start.
name: Hop Up
